title: Responsive Ahmedabad Service Areas section with discount note

requirements.summary: Add a new Service Areas section component with the specified centered container, responsive 8-card grid, and footnote line.
acceptanceCriteria: The section renders with padding similar to `py-12` and a light blue background similar to `bg-blue-50`.
The content is centered in a max-width container with horizontal padding (e.g., `container mx-auto px-4`) and `text-center` alignment.
A responsive grid renders with `grid-cols-2` on small screens and `md:grid-cols-4` on medium and larger screens, with consistent gaps similar to `gap-6`.
Exactly 8 cards are displayed, each styled with a white background, rounded corners, subtle shadow, and a left border accent similar to `border-l-4`.

file_operations.description: Create a React + TypeScript section component implementing the required structure: section wrapper (py-12, light-blue background), centered container with headline, responsive 8-item grid (2 cols mobile, 4 cols md+), and a footnote line below the grid.
Create the app root component to render the new ServiceAreasSection so the section is not orphaned and appears in the UI.

requirements.summary: Ensure all user-facing text in the section is in English while preserving meaning and keeping locality names exactly as provided.
acceptanceCriteria: The headline is in English and communicates: "Our special service in these areas of Ahmedabad" (or equivalent meaning), and uses emphasis similar to `text-3xl font-bold ... italic`.

The footnote is in English and communicates: "Special discount available for customers in Hanspura and Nana Chiloda" (or equivalent meaning) and is styled similarly to `mt-8 text-gray-600 font-medium`.
Area card labels match the provided list: "Hanspura (હંસપુરા)", "Shahibaug (શાહીબાગ)", "New Shahibaug", "Nana Chiloda", "Nikol (નિકોલ)", "Naroda (નરોડા)", "Bapunagar", "Gandhinagar".

file_operations.description: Set the headline and footnote to English equivalents (preserving meaning) and ensure the 8 area labels exactly match the provided spellings, including parenthetical Gujarati where present.

requirements.summary: Apply the required orange/blue left-border grouping for cards and keep card typography consistent across all areas.
acceptanceCriteria: Cards 1–4 (Hanspura, Shahibaug, New Shahibaug, Nana Chiloda) have an orange left border accent.
Cards 5–8 (Nikol, Naroda, Bapunagar, Gandhinagar) have a blue left border accent.
Each card displays its area name with bold styling similar to `font-bold text-lg`.

file_operations.description: Implement deterministic styling so the first four cards use an orange left border accent and the last four use a blue left border accent, while keeping card title typography consistent (bold, text-lg) for all cards.

requirements.summary: Enforce a coherent, consistent visual theme for the section aligned with the blue/orange accent direction without adding unrelated UI features.
acceptanceCriteria: The section uses a consistent palette and type scale aligned with the provided Tailwind classes (light blue background, blue headline text, orange/blue accents on cards).
No additional product features (forms, authentication, new pages) are introduced as part of styling work.

file_operations.description: Refine Tailwind styling to keep spacing, typography, and card treatments consistent across the whole section (headline color/weight/italics, grid spacing, card padding/shadow/rounded corners) while staying aligned with the blue/orange accent direction and avoiding any new features.
Add the Tailwind CSS entry file (Tailwind directives and any minimal global defaults needed by the app) so the section styling renders correctly with Tailwind.
